snippet: Waterfront property values in the New York area are unlikely to suffer in the long term, but new regulations — and buyers’ expectations — could affect how it is built and sold.
abstract: Public officials, real estate professionals and homeowners are being forced to reevaluate waterfront properties in the New York City area, ordinarily some of most coveted in nation, in light of damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.
lead_paragraph: Waterfront property values in the New York area are unlikely to suffer in the long term, but new regulations — and buyers’ expectations — could affect how it is built and sold.

headline.seo: After Hurricane Sandy, Would You Buy on the Waterfront?
headline.main: Would You Buy on the Waterfront?
headline.print_headline: Would You Buy on the Waterfront?
